item.title: [Python] Solving the frequent Fernet Key cryptography error for containerized Apache-Airflow
item.description: ![AirflowLogo.png](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/538885/a8895a6d-3950-c59f-420f-68f2b4e51a69.png) The Issue For security purposes, sensitive connection and administrative information is encrypted with a Fernet key before being stored in Airflow’s backend database. This includes any passwords for your connection objects as well as service account keys for e.g. Google Cloud. However, if you have built Airflow webserver as a containerized service, then every time you modify and rebuild your container you run the risk of invalidating your Fernet key and losing access to your connections.
